batting_archetype.scrub: A reliable injury replacement, he consistently performs when called upon.
batting_archetype.career minor leaguer: Known for stepping in as an emergency starter, his versatility is an asset.
batting_archetype.september callup: An everyday player who contributes consistently both at the plate and in the field.
batting_archetype.injury replacement: Primarily used in a platoon role, excelling against specific matchups.
batting_archetype.AAAA player: A fringe major leaguer, he struggles to find consistent playing time at the highest level.
batting_archetype.backup: A reliable injury replacement, he consistently performs when called upon.
batting_archetype.platoon: Primarily used in a platoon role, excelling against specific matchups.
batting_archetype.regular starter: An everyday player who contributes consistently both at the plate and in the field.
batting_archetype.star: A perennial All-Star, he’s a game-changer who can carry a team on his back.
batting_archetype.5-tool: A rare talent, he excels in all aspects of the game, making him a true superstar.

batting.text: He’s a slap hitter who uses all fields to get on base.
He’s a contact hitter who consistently puts the ball in play.
He’s a line-drive hitter with an ability to hit for average.
He’s a power hitter who can change the game with one swing.

power.text: He has almost no power to speak of.
He has occasional pop, but struggles to hit the long ball consistently.
His bat delivers home runs effortlessly.

eye.text: He has a poor eye at the plate, frequently chasing pitches out of the zone.
He’s an aggressive hitter who rarely walks.
He’s developing a better approach at the plate, showing improvement in pitch recognition.
He has a good eye at the plate, drawing walks with ease.
He’s an elite on-base threat, with exceptional pitch recognition.

speed.text: He’s extremely slow on the basepaths.
He’s an average runner, capable of taking extra bases when needed.

fielding.text: He’s a liability in the field, with a tendency to make costly errors.
He has average defensive skills, serviceable at his position.
He’s a solid fielder who can handle a variety of positions with competence.
He’s a defensive wizard, making plays that leave fans in awe.

batting_potential.text: His development is still in its early stages, but with the right coaching, he could blossom.
He’s nearing his potential, but there’s still room for growth.
Having reached his peak, he is expected to maintain his current performance level.

makeup.text: He’s a natural leader, inspiring his teammates to perform at their best.
He’s a respected teammate and always sets a good example.
He’s a clubhouse cancer, causing tension and discord among his teammates.

pitching_archetype.journeyman: He’s a workhorse who can pitch deep into games without losing effectiveness.
pitching_archetype.fringe starter: He’s a one-inning specialist who struggles to maintain his stuff over multiple frames.
pitching_archetype.late bloomer: His development is still in its early stages, but with the right coaching, he could blossom.
pitching_archetype.spot starter: Primarily used in a platoon role, excelling against specific matchups.
pitching_archetype.quad-a arm: A fringe major leaguer, he struggles to find consistent playing time at the highest level.
pitching_archetype.emergency starter: Known for stepping in as an emergency starter, his versatility is an asset.
pitching_archetype.back of rotation: He’s a solid back-of-the-rotation starter, offering dependable innings.
pitching_archetype.regular starter: He’s a reliable starter who consistently delivers quality innings.
pitching_archetype.top of rotation: He’s an ace who can take over a game at any time.
pitching_archetype.ace: He’s a top-of-the-rotation ace who can dominate even the best hitters.
pitching_archetype.filler arm: Fills out the minor league rosters, nothing more.
pitching_archetype.taxi squad reliever: A fringe major leaguer, he struggles to find consistent playing time at the highest level.
pitching_archetype.roster expansion reliever: Primarily used in a platoon role, excelling against specific matchups.
pitching_archetype.bullpen patch: Minor league arm that can provide some innings for a depleted bullpen.
pitching_archetype.mop-up: Low-leverage reliever who eats innings in blowout games.
pitching_archetype.spot-starter: Low leverage reliever who can provide multiple innings or start in a pinch.
pitching_archetype.low-leverage: Low leverage reliever who sits comfortably in the middle relief role.
pitching_archetype.high-leverage: High leverage reliever who can be counted on in key situations.
pitching_archetype.closer: Closer who can shut the door in the 9th inning.

start_value.text: He’s a liability as a starter, struggling to get through the lineup more than once.
He’s a solid back-of-the-rotation starter, offering dependable innings.
He’s a reliable starter who consistently delivers quality innings.
He’s an ace who can take over a game at any time.

endurance.text: He’s a one-inning specialist who struggles to maintain his stuff over multiple frames.
He’s capable of working into the middle innings with decent effectiveness.
He’s a workhorse who can pitch deep into games without losing effectiveness.

sho_rating.text: He struggles to keep runs off the board, often needing help from the bullpen.
He can occasionally dominate a game, putting zeros on the scoreboard.
He’s a shutdown starter who can blank the opposition.

relief_value.text: He's a liability out of the bullpen, often giving up runs in key moments.
He's a serviceable arm who can get a few outs when needed.
He's a reliable reliever capable of holding leads and getting big outs.
He's a shutdown reliever who can be counted on in high-leverage situations.

fatigue.text: He tires easily and needs long recovery times between outings.
He can handle a moderate workload but needs to be monitored carefully.
He’s a workhorse who can pitch deep into games without losing effectiveness.

pitching_potential.text: His development is still in its early stages, but with the right coaching, he could blossom.
He’s nearing his potential, but there’s still room for growth.
Having reached his peak, he is expected to maintain his current performance level.
